intro: Lannea angolensis, commonly known as the Angola wood apple, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and simple, alternate leaves. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits that split open to release seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is also valued for its hard timber and has traditional uses in local communities.
